{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561701,"name":"","username":"Tedzzy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T14:38:28.604Z","cooked":"

I am currently finished designing our team’s 2 stage cascading elevator, and I am willing to add LED strips on both sides of the elevator. I am wondering if I should add the LED strips on the outside or inside the tube.

Screenshot 2025-03-19 at 22.37.09630×1344 204 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T14:38:28.604Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":95.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496202,"topic_slug":"best-led-practice-for-elevator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5737→9411→10558"},"post_url":"/t/best-led-practice-for-elevator/496202/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3561744,"name":"Clay","username":"63hz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/63hz/{size}/262762_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T15:17:16.673Z","cooked":"

I think you’re going to be much happier with the LEDs inside the tubes. They’re protected in there. Depending on your setup, you may not even be able to fit them on the outside. The elevator bearing blocks roll up and down 3 of the 4 faces of your outermost vertical tubes. Wouldn’t want to get in the way of those. Since you’ve weight-saved the outer oat tube faces, there’s not much to attach LEDs to on that face.

We put our LEDs inside the tubes and added diffuser sheets to make sure LED illumination could be seen from all angles.

Here’s a picture of the elevator right after it was installed onto the robot.

20250220_2329501920×3410 516 KB
